How Donald Trump is using the military in Los Angeles for political gain
subhead: Thousands of soldiers have been deployed in Los Angeles to support the police tasked with arresting undocumented individuals. This unprecedented decision in a major American city has allowed the American president to test the limits of executive power.

US judge extends detention of pro-Palestinian protest leader Mahmoud Khalil
subhead: Khalil, a former NYU graduate student and one of the most visible leaders of nationwide campus protests against Israel's war in Gaza, was expected to be released after a US district judge issued the order on Wednesday, but is now being 'detained on another, second charge.'

title: In Ukraine, the Dnipropetrovsk region faces threats of a Russian breakthrough toward Pokrovsk
subhead: Moscow, which has aimed to seize the strategic city in the Donetsk region, declares to have crossed the administrative border − a claim Kyiv denies.

title: 'Can robots beat the wolves of Wall Street?'
subhead: According to a study conducted by Stanford University, artificial intelligence has outperformed 93% of US equity mutual fund managers. So it is hardly surprising that the asset management industry is doubling down on technology, observes Isabelle Chaperon, economics reporter for Le Monde.

title: Thomas Piketty: 'Opponents of the tax on the ultra-wealthy lack historical perspective'
subhead: After France's Sénat voted against a 2% wealth tax for people whose worth exceeds €100 million, the economist argues that the scale of France's debt and funding needs for social and climate challenges will soon require even more radical redistributive measures.

Two Jewish sisters' fight to honor the couple who hid them during the Holocaust
subhead: Arlette and Madeleine Testyler campaigned so that Jeanne and Jean Philippeau, who sheltered them during World War II, be recognized as Righteous Among the Nations. After some hesitation from the mayor, the town of Vendôme is organizing a ceremony on June 16 in which they will be honored by the Yad Vashem Institute.

title: In Rome, Maria Grazia Chiuri's final bow
subhead: It was in her hometown that Dior's artistic director, Maria Grazia Chiuri, chose to stage her farewell show on May 27. Though nothing was revealed that day about her departure, the designer decided to celebrate the art and culture of the Italian capital, where she has just brought a small theater back to life near the Forum.

title: French-Algerian woman given 48 hours to leave France in incomprehensible deportation order
subhead: A 58-year-old mother, who has been living in France since 1993 and holds dual nationality, was detained for an entire afternoon by border police at a Paris airport. She is contesting the order to leave French territory that was served to her.
